services.name: Amazon EC2
services.shortDescription: Scalable virtual servers in the cloud
services.description: Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (EC2) provides secure, resizable compute capacity in the cloud. It is designed to make web-scale cloud computing easier for developers by providing complete control over computing resources.
usageSteps: Sign in to AWS Management Console
Select an instance type based on your needs
Review and launch with key pair

realWorldExamples.title: Web Application Hosting
realWorldExamples.description: Host scalable web applications with auto-scaling capabilities

realWorldExamples.title: Development Environments
realWorldExamples.description: Create isolated development and testing environments

realWorldExamples.title: Big Data Processing
realWorldExamples.description: Process large datasets with high-performance computing instances

architecture.description: EC2 instances run in Virtual Private Clouds (VPCs) with security groups acting as virtual firewalls

services.name: Amazon S3
services.shortDescription: Object storage service with industry-leading scalability
services.description: Amazon Simple Storage Service (S3) is an object storage service offering industry-leading scalability, data availability, security, and performance. Customers can store and protect any amount of data for virtually any use case.
usageSteps: Access S3 console from AWS Management Console
Create a new S3 bucket with unique name
Upload files using drag-and-drop or API
Configure lifecycle policies for cost optimization
Set up CloudFront for content delivery

realWorldExamples.title: Static Website Hosting
realWorldExamples.description: Host static websites with global content delivery

realWorldExamples.title: Data Backup and Archive
realWorldExamples.description: Store backup data with multiple storage classes for cost optimization

realWorldExamples.title: Content Distribution
realWorldExamples.description: Distribute media files and software downloads globally

architecture.description: S3 stores objects in buckets across multiple Availability Zones for durability

services.name: Amazon RDS
services.description: Amazon Relational Database Service (RDS) makes it easy to set up, operate, and scale a relational database in the cloud. It provides cost-efficient and resizable capacity while automating time-consuming administration tasks.
usageSteps: Navigate to RDS in AWS Console
Choose instance class and storage type
Set up backup and monitoring options

realWorldExamples.title: E-commerce Applications
realWorldExamples.description: Store product catalogs, user data, and transaction records

realWorldExamples.title: Content Management
realWorldExamples.description: Manage website content and user-generated data

realWorldExamples.title: Analytics Platform
realWorldExamples.description: Store and analyze business metrics and KPIs

architecture.description: RDS instances run in VPCs with Multi-AZ deployment for high availability

services.name: AWS Lambda
services.shortDescription: Run code without thinking about servers
services.description: AWS Lambda lets you run code without provisioning or managing servers. You pay only for the compute time you consume - there is no charge when your code is not running.
usageSteps: Choose authoring method (from scratch, blueprint, etc.)
Set up execution role and permissions
Write or upload your function code

realWorldExamples.title: API Backend
realWorldExamples.description: Create serverless APIs with API Gateway integration

realWorldExamples.title: Data Processing
realWorldExamples.description: Process files uploaded to S3 automatically

realWorldExamples.title: Scheduled Tasks
realWorldExamples.description: Run periodic maintenance and cleanup tasks

architecture.description: Lambda functions are triggered by events and scale automatically

services.name: Amazon VPC
services.shortDescription: Virtual private cloud for isolated network environments
services.description: Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) enables you to launch AWS resources in a logically isolated virtual network that you define. You have complete control over your virtual networking environment.
usageSteps: Access VPC Dashboard in AWS Console
Define CIDR block for your VPC
Set up Internet Gateway for public access
Create NAT Gateway for private subnet internet access

realWorldExamples.title: Multi-tier Applications
realWorldExamples.description: Separate web, application, and database tiers with different subnets

realWorldExamples.title: Hybrid Cloud
realWorldExamples.description: Connect on-premises networks to AWS using VPN or Direct Connect

realWorldExamples.title: Compliance Requirements
realWorldExamples.description: Meet regulatory requirements with network isolation

architecture.description: VPCs provide isolated networking with customizable IP ranges and routing

services.name: Compute Engine
services.shortDescription: Virtual machines running on Google's infrastructure
services.description: Google Compute Engine provides scalable, high-performance virtual machines running on Google's infrastructure. It offers both predefined and custom machine types to optimize for your specific workloads.
usageSteps: Select operating system and boot disk
Set up network and storage options

realWorldExamples.title: High-Performance Computing
realWorldExamples.description: Run scientific simulations and data analysis workloads

realWorldExamples.title: Game Servers
realWorldExamples.description: Host multiplayer game servers with low latency

realWorldExamples.title: Batch Processing
realWorldExamples.description: Process large datasets in parallel across multiple instances

architecture.description: Compute Engine VMs run in zones within regions with automatic scaling capabilities

services.name: Cloud Storage
services.shortDescription: Unified object storage for any amount of data
services.description: Google Cloud Storage is a unified object storage solution that allows you to store any amount of data and retrieve it as often as you'd like. It's designed for 99.999999999% durability.
usageSteps: Create a new bucket with unique name
Upload files via console, CLI, or API

realWorldExamples.title: Data Lake
realWorldExamples.description: Store structured and unstructured data for analytics

realWorldExamples.title: Media Streaming
realWorldExamples.description: Store and serve video and audio content globally

realWorldExamples.title: Mobile App Backend
realWorldExamples.description: Store user-generated content and app assets

architecture.description: Cloud Storage provides global object storage with multiple storage classes

services.name: BigQuery
services.shortDescription: Serverless data warehouse for analytics at scale
services.description: BigQuery is Google's fully managed, serverless data warehouse that enables super-fast SQL queries using the processing power of Google's infrastructure.
usageSteps: Access BigQuery in Google Cloud Console
Load data from various sources (CSV, JSON, etc.)
Write SQL queries to analyze data
Use the query editor to run analytics
Set up scheduled queries for automation
Export results or connect to BI tools

realWorldExamples.title: Business Intelligence
realWorldExamples.description: Analyze sales data and generate business insights

realWorldExamples.title: IoT Data Analysis
realWorldExamples.description: Process and analyze sensor data from IoT devices

realWorldExamples.title: Marketing Analytics
realWorldExamples.description: Analyze customer behavior and campaign performance

architecture.description: BigQuery separates storage and compute for efficient querying of large datasets

services.name: Cloud Functions
services.description: Google Cloud Functions is a serverless execution environment for building and connecting cloud services. It automatically scales and charges only when your code runs.
usageSteps: Set trigger type (HTTP, Cloud Storage, etc.)
Write function code in the editor

realWorldExamples.title: Image Processing
realWorldExamples.description: Automatically resize images uploaded to Cloud Storage

realWorldExamples.title: API Microservices
realWorldExamples.description: Create lightweight REST APIs for mobile apps

realWorldExamples.title: Data Transformation
realWorldExamples.description: Process and transform data in real-time

architecture.description: Cloud Functions execute in response to events and scale automatically

services.name: Kubernetes Engine
services.shortDescription: Managed Kubernetes service for containerized applications
services.description: Google Kubernetes Engine (GKE) is a managed environment for deploying, managing, and scaling containerized applications using Google infrastructure.
usageSteps: Configure node pools and machine types

realWorldExamples.title: Microservices Architecture
realWorldExamples.description: Deploy and manage microservices-based applications

realWorldExamples.title: CI/CD Pipelines
realWorldExamples.description: Automate deployment pipelines for containerized apps

realWorldExamples.description: Run portable applications across different cloud providers

architecture.description: GKE manages Kubernetes clusters with automatic scaling and updates

services.name: Virtual Machines
services.description: Azure Virtual Machines provide on-demand, scalable computing resources. Create Linux and Windows virtual machines in seconds and pay only for what you use.
usageSteps: Configure basic settings and resource group
Choose VM size and operating system

realWorldExamples.description: Migrate legacy applications to the cloud

realWorldExamples.description: Create development environments for software testing

services.name: Blob Storage
services.description: Azure Blob Storage is Microsoft's object storage solution for the cloud. It's optimized for storing massive amounts of unstructured data, such as text or binary data.
usageSteps: Upload files using portal, CLI, or SDK
Set up CDN for global distribution

services.name: SQL Database
services.shortDescription: Managed SQL database as a service
services.description: Azure SQL Database is a fully managed relational database with auto-scale, integral intelligence, and robust security. It's built for the cloud with all the benefits of a fully managed service.
usageSteps: Navigate to Azure SQL in the portal
Choose service tier and compute size
Set up firewall rules and security
